notesStmt.note:
Shelomoh ben Mosheh ben Yosef: inscribed with his name in the author's colophon (folio 141r).
Perets ben Menaḥem sold to Eli῾ezer ben Avraham: inscribed with his name in a purchase note (14th century) (folio 1r). Purchase note, mostly illegible (folio 1r). Acquisition note, partially illegible (folio 1r).
Shelomoh ben Yekutiel ben Shelomoh: inscribed with his name (16th century) (folios 144v, 145r).Recipe for making ink (folio 145r).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), Italian bibliophile: his collection no. 85; 322 Hebrew manuscripts were acquired from his library by the British Museum in 1865 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum: inscribed in Hebrew 'MS 85' (folio [iv verso]).
